title: X-Author Contract to pick up value from more than 1 object levels
author: Swapnil Devlekar
content: Currently, X-Author Contracts can pull up data from only one object level down e.g. Agreement > Agreement Lines. But we also have many use cases where we need to track or print information from more than one object level e.g. Agreement > Agreement Lines > Payment Terms. This is a pretty regular use case and has been asked by Roche and many customers.

title: Support insert with clause formatting for DAR
author: Namir Ashraf
content: As of now, we do not support the INSERT WITH clause formatting in the DAR section. The customer has requested this enhancement to support their use case.

title: Ability for Users to Specify Save Location when checking out a Document
author: Matt Penrod
content: Currently, when user's check out a document in X-Author 2.0, the document is saved to the Default local file location (specified in Microsoft Word). If they attempt to use Microsoft's Save functionality they can change the location to where the document is being saved, but when they go to check out a different document with X-Author 2.0, the document that is checked out saves to the last saved location (and not the Default local file location). Users would like the ability to specify the save location for their documents when they are being checked out with X-Author 2.0.

title: In X-Author's we would want to add more than 9 rows in Segment condition

content: In the XAC 2.0 and 1.0 we have a limit to add only 9 rows, we would want to increase that limit as there is customers requirement were they want to add 10 rows of conditions but due to the 9-row limit we are not able to add more rows.

title: Ability to Identify Mismatched Content Control Boxes
author: Matt Penrod
content: Customer (Verizon) is experiencing issues with the number of content controls in their document not matching the number of Doc Clauses in the X-Author 2.0 panel. This mismatch is causing a 'MarkedForDeletion' error message that prevents the users from being able to check in the particular document. The customer has a lot of content controls (50+) in their documents and it is not easy to identify which specific content control box that is causing the issue. Having the ability to identify (highlight) particular content control boxes that are not matched to a Doc Clause, will help users to easily identify the issue and remove the mismatched content control (saving their users a lot of time).

title: There should be version number available on the X-Author 2.0
author: ECOM Help Desk
content: As checked, there is no version number available on he XAC 2.0 but version number must be available.

title: Keep Special Characters in Microsoft Word when Naming a Document
author: Matt Penrod
content: In X-Author 1.0, the document name in Microsoft Word would preserve any special characters that were utilized. When checking out a document in X-Author 2.0, the punctuation does not show up in the document name in Microsoft Word. The document name shows up correctly in Salesforce and X-Author 2.0, but the name that shows up in Microsoft Word does not keep any of the special characters/punctuation.

title: Default Read-Only Clauses at the Template Level
author: Matt Penrod
content: Customer (Verizon) is looking for the ability to restrict the type of clause being used for specific templates. Having a template level setting that defaults the clause type to 'Read-Only' would prevent users from accidentally inserting the wrong clause type.

title: Automatically close instance of Word when checking in and unprotecting a document
author: Matt Penrod
content: Whenever a user checks in a document with X-Author Contracts 2.0 a new instance of Microsoft Word opens for the new document. The previous instance of Word remains open which can cause users to not be sure about which instance of Word they should be working in. This also happens when a user attempts to unprotect a document. A second instance of Microsoft Word will open and the first instance will remain open. Having so many instances of Microsoft Word open can cause confusion for the user who may be checking in/checking out a large number of documents every day.

title: X-Author Check in and Check out permissions
author: Alison Aubuchon
content: When you check out a document in X-Author it should remove the document protection so you can accept and reject changes and it should auto lock when checking in a document.

title: X-Author Templates - allow for searching/recently used option in Fields when creating Segments
author: Alison Aubuchon
content: When you are creating a segment conditional the list of fields is not searchable and you have to scroll through a long list. Or maybe include a recently used section for the fields that we use often.

title: X-Author Templates - allow for naming of segments
author: Alison Aubuchon
content: It is impossible to figure out what segment you need to review or update because they are all named Segment Conditional. You have to click through each to find the one you are looking for. If you could rename them it would be easier to navigate.

title: In XAC, Section template/clauses should be supported in header & footer part of the template and we should publish them accordingly
author: Dhaval Prajapati
content:
The customer is having a following use case which is not supported in current XAC:
 
Use case: Customer's logo is frequently getting updated. Hence, they want to add a logo (with some merge field line Agreement number) in section template/clause and add this section template/clause in the header of the template. Then, whenever is logo is changed, they will update it in related section clause/template and will publish it such that it gets updated in respected Agreement template (where it is added in the header).
 
However, as per the current XAC functionality, section clause/templates are not supported in header and footer of template. Hence, publish functionality is also not working for them as per the expectation. Thus, customer has to manually update each template and they have a good number of templates. So, it’s difficult to update each template when logo is changed.
 
Hence, if we can provide such functionality which supports section clause/template in the header and footer part of the template and one can publish them accordingly to fulfill the mentioned use case.

It is causing a lot of issue in maintaining and creating new clause template and as the customers business requirement this is a key feature.

content:

content:
See 3 BD X-Author 2.0 use cases below for Conga to consider:
 
BD Use Case: 
“As a BD Contract Consultant, after I generate an agreement and open it in X-Author, I need to be able to see the comments that were originally on the CLM Template.”
 
These comments include:
“If – then” scenarios, at the discretion of the business unit. Example comment: “Instructions: Delete if pricing is per GPO and insert the following language below Pricing”.Additional notes from the Legal Team/Contract Consultant/others, addressed to the BD Contract Consultant working on the contract. Example comment: “Instructions: 2/10/22-Email from Jim Sommer relating to agreements where the offered pricing is lower than the lowest priced tier on the National Agreement, which also (typically) provide for higher levels of commitment. Other considerations – These pricing agreements are typically terminable on 60-days’ notice.”Additional decision points, asking the BD Contract Consultant to add or remove sections based on the individual situation with the Customer. Example comment: “Instructions: If the Volume Commitment is less than 70% the non-full line supplier is not required, and this section may be removed and instead mark this section as “RESERVED” or delete and renumber and correct the sections that survive termination of this agreement.”

title: Error popup on check in when the document is opened in word and edited directly from email without saving
author: Gunjan Vazirani
content:
Issue: Receiving an error message while checking-in an document in XAC 2.0.
Description: When we open an document directly from the email which is sent for review and connect it to XAC and check-in the document we receive the error message-"An unexpected error has occurred. Please try again The application has encountered an error. Please contract the administrator".
 
Steps to Replicate: 
1. Login to org
2. Go to Agreement
3. Send the document for review(I have just imported an offline document for testing)
4. Go to the email received, without downloading just open the document received in word
5. Login to XAC 2.0 
6. Make some changes in the document and then click on finish.
7. We will see a message that the document is checked in successfully but then an error is thrown : "An unexpected error has occurred. Please try again The application has encountered an error. Please contract the administrator"
 
Current scenario: This is a product limitation currently and users need to save a copy of the attachment to local before check-in. Workaround is to save the document locally and then check-in with changes.
 
Expectation:
a) If the document is to be saved locally first then a meaningful error should be thrown.
b) The idea is to have one single storage place. There should not be a need to save the file locally and in Salesforce.

title: Differentiating changes in smart fields during parallel review

content:

* In this process, there can be a scenario where a field was never modified by the last reviewer but the final merged document will show it as redlined and mark the final change against last reviewer, because previous reviewer had changed it's value.
* This scenario is misleading for Michelin. We have already recommended 'Office 365 review process' to them to avoid this, but they have requested below mentioned feature on XAC 2.0.

Customer's Suggestion :

* Once the review process is complete, when the Contract Manager or owner checks out the final merged copy, under Doc Fields tab in XAC, they should be able to see the fields value submitted by each reviewer.
* Customer's expectation is to see additional fields (with reviewer's name as Header) and the field value which was submitted by them in review check-in process.

title: X-Author Contracts both XAC1.0 & XAC2.0 should process faster for Complex Documents
author: Jay Patel
content:
Very Slow processing for Complex Documents: Unable to check in an agreement doc using X-Author v2 (v2103), take very long time, same with XAC1.0 11.27.127.


• The document contains 50+ clauses and might be conditional so there are many fields as well.

• The clauses are smart so XAC has to reconcile them while every check-in.

• This document also has 7 repeat tables with lots of fields (some of them are having more than 40+ fields). And again these repeat tables might contain the condition so it will be more complex.

• Due to the complexity of metadata, it is taking time as XAC has to retrieve the metadata and validate the data every time so it is taking much time.


After a VERY long time (15+ minutes Or 20+ minutes Or more) the document gets checked-in sucessfully, but ususally end user loses the patience after 5-7 minutes.
